apis.description: Returns the list of active courses for the current user.

operations.notes: Returns the list of active courses for the current user.

parameters.name: enrollment_type
parameters.description: When set, only return courses where the user is enrolled as this type. For example, set to "teacher" to return only courses where the user is enrolled as a Teacher. This argument is ignored if enrollment_role is given.

parameters.name: enrollment_role
parameters.description: When set, only return courses where the user is enrolled with the specified course-level role. This can be a role created with the {api:RoleOverridesController#add_role Add Role API} or a base role type of 'StudentEnrollment', 'TeacherEnrollment', 'TaEnrollment', 'ObserverEnrollment', or 'DesignerEnrollment'.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: - "needs_grading_count": Optional information to include with each Course. When needs_grading_count is given, and the current user has grading rights, the total number of submissions needing grading for all assignments is returned. - "syllabus_body": Optional information to include with each Course. When syllabus_body is given the user-generated html for the course syllabus is returned. - "total_scores": Optional information to include with each Course. When total_scores is given, any enrollments with type 'student' will also include the fields 'calculated_current_score', 'calculated_final_score', 'calculated_current_grade', and 'calculated_final_grade'. calculated_current_score is the student's score in the course, ignoring ungraded assignments. calculated_final_score is the student's score in the course including ungraded assignments with a score of 0. calculated_current_grade is the letter grade equivalent of calculated_current_score (if available). calculated_final_grade is the letter grade equivalent of calculated_final_score (if available). This argument is ignored if the course is configured to hide final grades. - "term": Optional information to include with each Course. When term is given, the information for the enrollment term for each course is returned.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: If set, only return courses that are in the given state(s). By default, "available" is returned for students and observers, and anything except "deleted", for all other enrollment types

apis.description: Create a new course

operations.notes: Create a new course

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the account to create to course under.

parameters.name: course[name]
parameters.description: The name of the course. If omitted, the course will be named "Unnamed Course."

parameters.name: course[course_code]
parameters.description: The course code for the course.

parameters.name: course[start_at]
parameters.description: Course start date in ISO8601 format, e.g. 2011-01-01T01:00Z

parameters.name: course[end_at]
parameters.description: Course end date in ISO8601 format. e.g. 2011-01-01T01:00Z

parameters.name: course[license]
parameters.description: The name of the licensing. Should be one of the following abbreviations (a descriptive name is included in parenthesis for reference): - 'private' (Private Copyrighted) - 'cc_by_nc_nd' (CC Attribution Non-Commercial No Derivatives) - 'cc_by_nc_sa' (CC Attribution Non-Commercial Share Alike) - 'cc_by_nc' (CC Attribution Non-Commercial) - 'cc_by_nd' (CC Attribution No Derivatives) - 'cc_by_sa' (CC Attribution Share Alike) - 'cc_by' (CC Attribution) - 'public_domain' (Public Domain).

parameters.name: course[is_public]
parameters.description: Set to true if course if public.

parameters.name: course[public_syllabus]
parameters.description: Set to true to make the course syllabus public.

parameters.name: course[public_description]
parameters.description: A publicly visible description of the course.

parameters.name: course[allow_student_wiki_edits]
parameters.description: If true, students will be able to modify the course wiki.

parameters.name: course[allow_wiki_comments]
parameters.description: If true, course members will be able to comment on wiki pages.

parameters.name: course[allow_student_forum_attachments]
parameters.description: If true, students can attach files to forum posts.

parameters.name: course[open_enrollment]
parameters.description: Set to true if the course is open enrollment.

parameters.name: course[self_enrollment]
parameters.description: Set to true if the course is self enrollment.

parameters.name: course[restrict_enrollments_to_course_dates]
parameters.description: Set to true to restrict user enrollments to the start and end dates of the course.

parameters.name: course[enroll_me]
parameters.description: Set to true to enroll the current user as the teacher.

parameters.name: course[sis_course_id]
parameters.description: The unique SIS identifier.

parameters.name: course[hide_final_grades]
parameters.description: If this option is set to true, the totals in student grades summary will be hidden.

parameters.name: course[apply_assignment_group_weights]
parameters.description: Set to true to weight final grade based on assignment groups percentages.

parameters.name: offer
parameters.description: If this option is set to true, the course will be available to students immediately.

parameters.name: course[syllabus_body]
parameters.description: The syllabus body for the course

apis.description:
Upload a file to the course.

This API endpoint is the first step in uploading a file to a course.
See the {file:file_uploads.html File Upload Documentation} for details on
the file upload workflow.

Only those with the "Manage Files" permission on a course can upload files
to the course. By default, this is Teachers, TAs and Designers.

operations.notes:
Upload a file to the course.

This API endpoint is the first step in uploading a file to a course.
See the {file:file_uploads.html File Upload Documentation} for details on
the file upload workflow.

Only those with the "Manage Files" permission on a course can upload files
to the course. By default, this is Teachers, TAs and Designers.

parameters.description: ID

apis.description: Returns the list of users in this course. And optionally the user's enrollments in the course.

operations.notes: Returns the list of users in this course. And optionally the user's enrollments in the course.

parameters.name: course_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: The partial name or full ID of the users to match and return in the results list.

parameters.name: enrollment_type
parameters.description: When set, only return users where the user is enrolled as this type. This argument is ignored if enrollment_role is given.

parameters.name: enrollment_role
parameters.description: When set, only return users enrolled with the specified course-level role. This can be a role created with the {api:RoleOverridesController#add_role Add Role API} or a base role type of 'StudentEnrollment', 'TeacherEnrollment', 'TaEnrollment', 'ObserverEnrollment', or 'DesignerEnrollment'.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: - "email": Optional user email. - "enrollments": Optionally include with each Course the user's current and invited enrollments. If the user is enrolled as a student, and the account has permission to manage or view all grades, each enrollment will include a 'grades' key with 'current_score', 'final_score', 'current_grade' and 'final_grade' values. - "locked": Optionally include whether an enrollment is locked. - "avatar_url": Optionally include avatar_url. - "test_student": Optionally include the course's Test Student, if present. Default is to not include Test Student.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: If included, the user will be queried and if the user is part of the users set, the page parameter will be modified so that the page containing user_id will be returned.

apis.description:
Returns the list of users in this course, ordered by how recently they have
logged in. The records include the 'last_login' field which contains
a timestamp of the last time that user logged into canvas.  The querying
user must have the 'View usage reports' permission.

operations.notes:
Returns the list of users in this course, ordered by how recently they have
logged in. The records include the 'last_login' field which contains
a timestamp of the last time that user logged into canvas.  The querying
user must have the 'View usage reports' permission.

apis.description:
Update multiple courses in an account.  Operates asynchronously; use the {api:ProgressController#show progress endpoint}
to query the status of an operation.

operations.notes:
Update multiple courses in an account.  Operates asynchronously; use the {api:ProgressController#show progress endpoint}
to query the status of an operation.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: course_ids
parameters.description: List of ids of courses to update. At most 500 courses may be updated in one call.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The action to take on each course. Must be one of 'offer', 'conclude', 'delete', or 'undelete'. * 'offer' makes a course visible to students. This action is also called "publish" on the web site. * 'conclude' prevents future enrollments and makes a course read-only for all participants. The course still appears in prior-enrollment lists. * 'delete' completely removes the course from the web site (including course menus and prior-enrollment lists). All enrollments are deleted. Course content may be physically deleted at a future date. * 'undelete' attempts to recover a course that has been deleted. (Recovery is not guaranteed; please conclude rather than delete a course if there is any possibility the course will be used again.) The recovered course will be unpublished. Deleted enrollments will not be recovered.

parameters.description: ID

parameters.description: ID

apis.description:
DEPRECATED: Please use the {api:ContentMigrationsController#create Content Migrations API}

Copies content from one course into another. The default is to copy all course
content. You can control specific types to copy by using either the 'except' option
or the 'only' option.

The response is the same as the course copy status endpoint

operations.notes:
DEPRECATED: Please use the {api:ContentMigrationsController#create Content Migrations API}

Copies content from one course into another. The default is to copy all course
content. You can control specific types to copy by using either the 'except' option
or the 'only' option.

The response is the same as the course copy status endpoint

parameters.name: course_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: source_course
parameters.description: ID or SIS-ID of the course to copy the content from

parameters.name: except
parameters.description: A list of the course content types to exclude, all areas not listed will be copied.

parameters.name: only
parameters.description: A list of the course content types to copy, all areas not listed will not be copied.

id.description: the unique identifier for the course

sis_course_id.description: the SIS identifier for the course, if defined

name.description: the full name of the course

workflow_state.description: the current state of the course one of 'unpublished', 'available', 'completed', or 'deleted'

account_id.description: the account associated with the course

root_account_id.description: the root account associated with the course

start_at.description: the start date for the course, if applicable

end_at.description: the end date for the course, if applicable

enrollments.description: A list of enrollments linking the current user to the course. for student enrollments, grading information may be included if include[]=total_scores

default_view.description: the type of page that users will see when they first visit the course - 'feed': Recent Activity Dashboard - 'wiki': Wiki Front Page - 'modules': Course Modules/Sections Page - 'assignments': Course Assignments List - 'syllabus': Course Syllabus Page other types may be added in the future

syllabus_body.description: optional: user-generated HTML for the course syllabus

needs_grading_count.description: optional: the number of submissions needing grading returned only if the current user has grading rights and include[]=needs_grading_count

term.description: optional: the name of the enrollment term for the course returned only if include[]=term

apply_assignment_group_weights.description: weight final grade based on assignment group percentages

permissions.description: optional: the permissions the user has for the course. returned only for a single course and include[]=permissions

public_description.example: Come one, come all to InstructureCon 2012!
